name: Albuquerque Muscle Car Association
description: The AMCA focuses on American muscle cars from the 1960s and 1970s. Monthly meetings, weekly cruises, and quarterly car shows make this one of the most active clubs in the state.

name: Santa Fe European Auto Society
description: Dedicated to the preservation and appreciation of European classic cars. The society hosts technical workshops, driving events, and an annual concours d'elegance in the historic plaza.

name: Route 66 Cruisers
description: A family-friendly club celebrating all vintages and types of classic cars with a focus on preserving the history of Route 66. Regular cruises along historic stretches of the Mother Road.

name: Las Cruces Hot Rod Association
description: One of the oldest clubs in New Mexico, focusing on hot rods, customs, and classics. The association is known for its community involvement and charity events.

name: Silver City Vintage Vehicles
description: A diverse club welcoming all types of classic and collectible vehicles. Known for their scenic drives through the Gila National Forest and annual charity drive for local food banks.

name: Farmington Classic Chrome Club
description: Specializing in chrome-era classics from the 1950s and early 1960s. The club hosts regular technical workshops on restoration and chrome preservation techniques.
